reporting-org.narrative: Centre de recherches pour le développement international
Centro Internacional de Investigaciones para el Desarrollo

title.narrative: Forger le nouveau partenariat entre le Canada et l'Indonésie

description.narrative: This project will support the Canada-Indonesia Forum, which aims to investigate ways to build a relationship between the two countries at a time of change and growing potential in Indonesia. Stronger links, improved opportunities Indonesia has undergone dramatic changes over the last two decades. Recent presidential elections have demonstrated that the democratic system is working. A new phase in Indonesia's political leadership and policies has taken root. The economy is strong and growing (GDP of $80 billion), with an average GDP growth rate of close to 6% since 2004. The middle class of 74 million is expected to double by 2020. From a Canadian perspective, Indonesia is a rising power on the global scene and a gateway into Southeast Asia, presenting a substantial economic and diplomatic opportunity. Indonesia is a priority country for Canadian aid and international trade. About the Canada-Indonesia Forum The forum is being organized by the Centre for International Governance Innovation (CIGI) in Canada and the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) in Indonesia. Held in Jakarta in May 2015, it will bring together 50 business executives, policy practitioners and experts, and government officials from both sides to discuss the following themes: -infrastructure development -energy and resource development -agriculture and food security -financial services for a stronger Indonesian middle class -governance and institution building -education and programs for youth -managing threats to regional security Ideas, knowledge, recommendations The forum will produce the following outputs: -three papers authored by CSIS Indonesian researchers -final report prepared by CIGI with practical ideas and recommendations for businesses, governments, and others The objective in sharing this knowledge is to develop the Canada-Indonesia relationship bilaterally and within the larger ASEAN region.

organisation.narrative: Centre de recherches pour le développement international

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 8500, Ottawa ON Canada, K1G 3H9

condition.narrative: Grant is conditional on completion of specified terms of reference, receipt of specified deliverables
La bourse est octroyée à condition de respecter le mandat établi et de livrer les résultats attendus
Grant is conditional on periodic submission of a detailed accounting of expenditure of funds received from IDRC accompanied by estimation of budget for the next reporting period

La bourse est octroyée à condition de périodiquement présenter une justification détaillée de l'utilisation des fonds versés par le CRDI ainsi qu'une estimation budgétaire de la période de rapport suivante
